qas.question: Which Atlantic writer gave a negative review of Spectre?
What adjective did Lawrence Toppman use to describe Craig's portrayal of James Bond?
What publication does Alyssa Rosenberg write for?
What was the catch phrase Lawrence Toppman of the Charlotte Observer used for the film?
Christopher Orr of the New Yorker said what about Spectre?
Lawrence Toppman of The Boston Observer called Craig's performance what?
Alyssa Rosenberg of The Washington Observer said what about the film?
Lawrence Orr writes for The Charlotte what?

context: <a0_0>Christopher Orr<a0_0/>, writing in The Atlantic, also criticised the film, saying that Spectre "<b4_0>backslides on virtually every [aspect]<b4_0/>". Lawrence Toppman of The Charlotte <b7_0>Observer<b7_0/> called Craig's performance "<a1_0><a3_0><b5_0>Bored<a1_0/>, James Bored<b5_0/><a3_0/>." Alyssa Rosenberg, writing for <a2_0>The Washington Post<a2_0/>, stated that the film turned into "<b6_0>a disappointingly conventional Bond film<b6_0/>."
